output.description: The response from the Google Calendar API
output.title: Google Calendar Response

sendUpdates.description: Whether to send notifications about the creation of the new event. The default is false.
sendUpdates.title: Send Updates

attachments.description:
Array of attachments. Each attachment should have a 'fileUrl' property.

SAMPLE INPUT:
```
[
    {
      "fileId": "file123",
      "fileUrl": "https://example.com/file123",
      "mimeType": "application/pdf",
      "title": "Sample PDF"
    }
 ]
```
attachments.title: Attachments

calendarId.description: Calendar identifier. Use 'primary' for the primary calendar of the currently logged in user.
calendarId.title: Calendar ID

supportsAttachments.description: Whether API client performing operation supports event attachments. Optional. The default is False.
supportsAttachments.title: Add Files

conferenceDataVersion.description: Version number of conference data supported by the API client. The default is 0. Acceptable values are 0 to 1, inclusive.
conferenceDataVersion.title: Conference?

attendees.description:
Array of attendees. Each attendee should have an 'email' property.

SAMPLE INPUT:
```
[
    {
      email: 'example@example.com',
      optional: false,
      displayName: 'John Doe'
    }
 ]
```
attendees.title: Attendees

start.description:
The (inclusive) start time of the event. For a recurring event, this is the start time of the first instance.

SAMPLE INPUT:
```
{
    "dateTime":"2024-01-06T09:00:00",
     "timeZone":"UTC"
}
```
start.title: Event Start Time

description.description: Description of the event. Can contain HTML. Optional.
description.title: Description

end.description:
The (exclusive) end time of the event. For a recurring event, this is the end time of the first instance.

SAMPLE INPUT:
```
{
    "dateTime":"2024-01-06T10:00:00",
     "timeZone":"UTC"
}
```
end.title: Event End Time

group.name: Google Calendar
group.description: OAuth Nodes for utilizing the Google Calendar API to retrieve and perform operations based on your Google Calendars.

calendarId.description: The identifier for the calendar. Use `primary` for the primary calendar of the currently logged in user.
calendarId.title: Calendar ID

timeMax.description:
Dates need to be in the ISO 8601 format, which look like this: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. 

**SAMPLE INPUTS:**

**For May 1, 2024, at 00:00:00 UTC:**
`2024-05-01T00:00:00Z`


**For May 31, 2024, at 23:59:59 UTC:**
`2024-05-31T23:59:59Z`
timeMax.title: End Date

timeMin.description:
Dates need to be in the ISO 8601 format, which look like this: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. 

**SAMPLE INPUTS:**

**For May 1, 2024, at 00:00:00 UTC:**
`2024-05-01T00:00:00Z`


**For May 31, 2024, at 23:59:59 UTC:**
`2024-05-31T23:59:59Z`
timeMin.title: Start Date
